intro: Discocalyx maculata, commonly known as the spotted bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple with distinctive white or yellow spots. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are opposite along the stem. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical name reflects its unique floral structure and spotted markings.
